page.title: 08Water Authority(Pevensey Bay
page.content: The S.W.A have their{depot}with stores and plant for all Sussex in Pevensey Bay.Here the Haven flows into the sea through a large pipe.The main tasks are to keep up the{shingle bank beach to{stop flooding }over the Pevensey Levels yet allow all land drainage water to get out to the sea.Years ago farmers(Commissioners of the Levels) looked after drainage to stop their fields becoming{salt marshes.}Now the S.W.A replaces and repairs groynes, monitors the water height to open and close the tidal doors to let the Haven flow into the sea at low tide.They check river pollution,clear rubbish, plants and silt to prevent culverts from blocking.Rivers are restocked with fish.An Archimedes'screw and some pumps drain the land.Drinking water comes from Arlington Reservoir; sewage is pumped out to sea.
